subject: Home & DIY
title: Palladio's Four Books of Architecture
description: A fast breakdown of Palladio's Four Books of Architecture for builders.

hook.text: One Italian architect's textbook from 1570 influenced more buildings worldwide than any other single work.

buildup.text: Andrea Palladio studied Roman ruins, measured them precisely, and distilled the principles into clear drawings.

discovery.text: His system of symmetry, proportion, and classical columns was easy to copy. Any builder could follow his plans.

twist.text: Thomas Jefferson used Palladio's book to design Monticello and the University of Virginia. It shaped American style.

climax.text: From English country houses to the White House, Palladian design became the default language of Western power.

punchline.text: One book designed half of Western civilization.

quiz.question: Which American president used Palladio's design principles for his own home?
